page.title: 08CRUWYS MORCHARD EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Main sources of employment are the 17 farms mostly run by family labour, and ancillary industries such as agricultural engineering and implement repairers in Tiverton. A few local men are agricultural contractors. The wood yard employed 12 until mid-August 1985 when four men were made redundant. Many drive daily to Tiverton or Exeter and work for the County or District Councils or private concerns. Two men have their own motor-repair business in Pennymoor. The broiler unit employs a resident manager plus one assistant. Contractors are hired to clean out the buildings. The Cruwys Arms public house employs one regular cleaner, one cook and casual bar staff. There are a few retired people and a small number of unemployed. Labour relations are good.
